question: What is this lump under my armpit skin?
question_content: Well, i'm only 13. But yesterday, i noticed this bump under the skin of my armpit. It's not visible at all. But, it hurts when you touch it. I felt it, and ut my fingers around it, and it's the size and shape of a pea. I'm not really freaking out, I'm just really curious because it really hurt when anything touches the skin right above where it is. Well, I've been having alot of mucus going down my throat (eww) lately, but no other flu like symptoms. I don't know if it's a tumor, or a lymph node, or what, but can you please help me, it's kinda weird now.

answers.answer_content:
It's probably a swollen lymph node. 
You probably already know this but a lot of people think that lymph nodes aren't supposed to be there, like a cyst or an abcess. But they're completely natural. 
When you get sick (you said you have a lot of mucus running down your throat), stressed, injured or anything that involves your immune system helping your body your lymph nodes will usually swell. Anything above 1cm is swollen in an adult and anything above .5 cm is swollen in a child. You're probably supposed to be somewhere in between there but it's just bigger and sore because you're sick. It's sore because lymph nodes get big quite quickly and that rapid expansion makes them tender. I'm not saying they expand fast enough for you to see them get big, but it's pretty fast for you to get used to.

You have nothing to worry about :)
Hope this helped!
